top_note: This comprehensive restoration estimate reflects restoration to pre-loss condition using Like Kind and Quality materials.

trades.name: Interior Reconstruction
trades.note: Multi-room restoration including Work Room, Recreation Room, Recreation Room Closet, Back Double Door Bedroom, Sump Room, Closet Two, Stair, Under Stairs

locations.name: Work Room
locations.note:
ROOM DIMENSIONS:
- Floor Area: 384.58 SF
- Wall Area (Net): 692.42 SF
- Ceiling Area: 384.58 SF
- Baseboard Length: 90.42 LF
- Height: 8.58 FT

Water damage restoration including drywall, insulation, and painting

items.name: Contents Manipulation/Protection
items.description: Manipulation and protection of room contents to prevent damage during restoration. Includes protective coverings (plastic sheeting, drop cloths).

items.name: Wall Drywall
items.description: Installation of 1/2-inch gypsum drywall on walls at 8.58 FT height. Includes drywall sheets, joint compound, tape, and screws with 10% waste allowance for cutting and fitting.

items.name: Ceiling Drywall
items.description: Installation of 5/8-inch gypsum drywall on ceilings at 8.58 FT height. Includes drywall sheets, joint compound, tape, and screws with 15% waste allowance for overhead installation complexity.

items.name: Wall Insulation
items.description: Installation of fiberglass batt insulation (R-13) in walls at 8.58 FT height. Includes 10% waste allowance for cutting and fitting.

items.name: Baseboard
items.description: Installation of baseboards. Includes nails and caulk with 10% waste allowance for cutting and mitered joints.

items.name: Wall Primer
items.description: Application of one coat of primer on walls at 8.58 FT height. Includes primer and application materials.

items.name: Wall Paint
items.description: Application of two coats of paint on walls at 8.58 FT height. Includes paint and application materials.

items.description: Application of two coats of ceiling paint at 8.58 FT height. Includes paint and application materials.

items.name: Baseboard Paint
items.description: Application of two coats of paint on baseboards. Includes paint and brushes.

items.name: Door Paint
items.description: Painting of two interior doors at 8.58 FT height. Includes paint and application materials.

items.name: Trim Paint
items.description: Painting of trim at 8.58 FT height. Includes paint and application materials.

items.name: Interior Door Unit
items.description: Installation of one pre-hung interior door unit at 8.58 FT height. Includes door, frame, and hardware with 5% waste allowance.

locations.name: Project Cleanup & Debris Disposal
locations.note: Comprehensive project cleanup and debris disposal from drywall, flooring, and baseboard work across all project areas

items.name: Dumpster & Disposal
items.description: Rental of a dumpster for 5000 lbs (2.5 tons) of debris, including carpet, carpet padding, and baseboards. Includes dumpster rental ($1250.00 for 10 days), disposal fees ($212.50 for 2.5 tons at $85/ton), and delivery/pickup fees ($250.00).

items.name: Hauling Labor
items.description: Hauling of 5000 lbs of debris, including carpet (359.88 lbs), carpet padding (134.96 lbs), baseboards (20.21 lbs), and miscellaneous debris (54.74 lbs). Base rate of $0.30/lb with $0.08/lb multi-story surcharge and $0.04/lb distance surcharge.

items.name: Daily Cleanup
items.description: Daily construction cleaning for 1887.62 SF over 8 days. Includes dust and debris removal from drywall, flooring, and painting work.

items.name: Final Cleanup
items.description: Final construction cleaning for 200 SF of common areas. Includes dust removal from surfaces, fixtures, and HVAC systems affected by drywall, flooring, and painting work.

bottom_note:
OVERHEAD (10%)
Overhead covers essential project management costs including coordination of 5 trades across 8 rooms spanning 1887.62 SF. This includes administrative expenses such as project documentation, scheduling, material procurement, and quality control oversight for standard coordination requirements. Additionally covers operational costs including equipment rental, vehicle expenses, job site utilities, and business infrastructure necessary for project completion over a 10-day timeline. General liability coverage, workers' compensation, and performance bonding are also included based on project scope and risk assessment. Special conditions such as multi-story basement access require additional overhead allocation for increased project management complexity.

PROFIT (4%)
Profit margin reflects current market standards for professional restoration contractors performing interior restoration work in the VA region. This rate provides appropriate compensation for financial investment, project risk assumption, and performance guarantee while ensuring business sustainability for standard complexity projects. The profit component covers the value of professional expertise, comprehensive warranty coverage, industry knowledge, and quality assurance that ensures successful project completion to pre-loss condition. This rate structure maintains competitive positioning while providing the resources necessary for excellence in execution and customer satisfaction.

SALES TAX (6%)
Applied to materials ($19,554.15) as required by VA jurisdiction. Tax calculation based on subtotal plus overhead and profit amounts per local regulations.
disclaimer: This estimate reflects restoration to pre-loss condition using Like Kind and Quality materials. Overhead and Profit rates reflect professional standards for the determined complexity level.
